result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody J. Bennett in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  14CF312 and 14CM251 to be DRI.
14CF328 Counts 1 and 3:  I/S Sentence: 120 days jail-stay:  18 Probation:   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. Pay costs from bond.  14CF328 Counts 2 and 4 to be DRI

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 Count 1 and Count 3 No Contests

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF328 Count 1 and 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  Cases
 14CF312, 14CM251, and 14CF328 Counts 2 & 4 are Dismissed Read In.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court and no objection to be served in LaCross County.
Atty Lueschow concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT: **********************Probation*************
14CF328 Count 1 and 3:
I/S Sentence: 120 days jail-stay, concurrent to each with huber for work and counseling:  18 Probation, concurrent 
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. 
Pay costs, drug and DNA surcharges from bond.
Plea hearing on February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody J. Bennett in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF312 and 14CF328.

10:35 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Branch 2 informs the parties that this Branch is assisting in this hearing today for Branch 1 and there are no objections.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered on all 3 counts.

BY THE COURT:
Pre-Trial Conference to be held today.
Bond Continued.
Arraignment on October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am. (New Notice generated and mailed 09-16-14.)

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued

Defendant Cody J. Bennett in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CM251, 14CF328, and 14CF312.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaints and waived their readings.
 
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and schedule for arraignments/Pretrial on 14CF328 and 14CF312 on 10-6, 14 at 10:30.
P/NG entered on 14CM251
Bond continued
Bond continued  Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cody J. Bennett in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF312, 14CF328, 14CM251

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint in 14CF328.
Informs the Court he has not received 14CF312 and 14CM251. 
Court will adjourn all files.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Appear in court on August 18 at 1:30 p.m.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC (2nd or subsequent offense-felony), Possession of drug paraphernalia.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent. 
Defendant makes statements re: the facts.  
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $850 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  8/18/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
